result.execSummary:
The defendant Tricia R. Lange was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tricia R. Lange in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that this is the defendant's motion to report to jail later than what was originally ordered.  
Atty Gumz states that today was the first time he has met with the defendant and asks the court to address the motion with the defendant.  Defendant makes motion arguments.
Atty Hendee makes arguments and asks the court to deny the motion.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders the defendant to report to jail to serve her sentence by Friday, September 1, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
to Court from Tricia R Lange
Motion hearing on August 28, 2017 at 03:45 pm.
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Tricia R. Lange in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 3.  Counts 1, 2 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 3.  
Counts 1, 2 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 3:  Court orders 20 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
*Credit = 6 days
  Report on or before August 21, 2017 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
*May serve in Milwaukee County
*Court costs = $243.00
*DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
*Restitution = $139.00 + $13.90 surcharge = $152.90
Cash bond to be applied to restitution and then the costs
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan for the Balance:  $50.00/month commencing on September 1, 2017

Counts 1, 2 & 4 to be dismissed and read-in.
Restitution Supplement
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 22, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Tricia R. Lange in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the matter is resolved; however due to a surgery coming up asks for a plea/sentencing date.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea/Sentencing
bond continued  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Return date on April 5, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that he has been in contact with his client and gives an updated address.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant has a court date in Ozaukee County on March 9th and asks for a return to be set after that date.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for April 5, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.
Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.

Defendant Tricia R. Lange in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.  Atty Hendee states that she is out on bond from Wauzakee County.
Atty Gumz responds and requests a $200 cash bond.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $200 Cash bond with conditions:
*No contact or going on the premises of the three stores listed in the complaint
*No contact with S.S.  Return date scheduled for September 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
